text: what is quadruple witching and why should you care we're going to go through exactly that I got this DM essentially asking if we could talk about quadruple witching and you know it doesn't take much to get me ready to talk about some options and derivatives so here we go in short it's pretty simple it's when we have multiple kinds of derivatives that expire on the same day so options Futures single stock futures stuff like that I actually made a little table to make it easier to tell and you'll notice there's actually more on here than just quadruple witching and I'll explain exactly why double witching essentially happens monthly and it is not a big impact so you could just essentially drop that off the bottom of your mind it doesn't matter just know it's a thing then there's triple witching this is kind of phased out when we started launching single stock future expirations when this was added it essentially all became quadruple witching so triple witching is Legacy you'll hear people referred to that but really they're referring to quadruple witching and when does it happen it's the standard expiration cycle for derivatives which is the third Friday of the month what months you might ask March June September and December so what's happening here on quadruple witching days which one of them is coming up very soon today's the 19th of June we have stock options stock index options stock index Futures and

text: is the third Friday of the month what months you might ask March June September and December so what's happening here on quadruple witching days which one of them is coming up very soon today's the 19th of June we have stock options stock index options stock index Futures and single stock futures all that expire on the the same day a lot of expirations that all kind of line up with one another the reason why this matters is because a lot of institutional driven Market activity will kick off there will be a lot of transactions that are coming in two different forms we have market makers that are going to be hedging positions coming into expiration for a lot of individual products that may or may not correspond with one another but then you're also going to have the speculators the position holders again on the institutional side that have positions that are closing down that they have to reopen further out in time this actually leads to different kinds of Arbitrage and trading opportunities for more sophisticated Traders which we could do a video on at some point but I want to walk you through most importantly what the impact is to the market it's kind of twofold you'll notice that volume is typically going to go up and you'll notice that volatility tends to spike and then contract again depending on the rest of the broad Market cycle but there definitely is a higher probability

text: vix also tends to contract so this very commonly is due to the market is seeing a slightly heightened sense coming into the event potentially then during the event itself it's not necessarily producing a whole lot of fireworks so then volatility also will contract even though the SP 500 has a very very small down day on average so the impact to you as a Trader is kind of simple you should be aware that it exists your positions likely depending on the position not likely to be blown up because of this this isn't something that should freak you out scare you anything like that you should simply be prepared for increase Market volatility potentially increase in Market volume we also might not want to trade a whole bunch on the day because as volatility tends to increase bid ask spreads will widen out a little bit but again it's not that big of a change so it really doesn't matter a ton the way I look at this is this is kind of like a secondary Force at this point markets have become way more efficient as you go through this data you'll actually see that the impact decreases as we get closer in time so it used to be kind of a bigger deal back in the day fewer expirations bigger deal not so much now still something to be aware of but not a massive driver so as always if there's any other follow-up questions
